Title: My government spent ₦130b on Ekiti roads in one year — Oyebanji
Summary: Ekiti State Governor, Biodun Abayomi Oyebanji, declared that ₦130 billion has been spent on the construction and maintenance of roads, representing the entire budget of the state three years ago .

Title: Rwanda to ‘accept up to 250 migrants’ from US
Summary: Rwanda said Tuesday it would accept up to 250 migrants from the United States . Washington has been pushing a deportation drive, with President Donald Trump’s deportation drive . Rwanda gave no details on who could be included in the deal .

Title: Clerics secure release of 32 hostages after talks with Bello Turji, others
Summary: Islamic clerics secure release of 32 individuals held in captivity by bandits in Zamfara State . The clerics secured the release following talks with Bello Turji and other armed group leaders .

Title: Muslim groups decry humanitarian catastrophe in Gaza
Summary: Muslim Awareness International (MAI) decries ongoing humanitarian catastrophe unfolding in Gaza . Thousands face hunger, displacement, and death amid continued military assaults .

Title: European countries announce $1 bn purchase of US weapons for Ukraine
Summary: The Netherlands, Sweden, Norway and Denmark will buy $1 billion of US weapons under a new NATO scheme to support Ukraine in its war against Russia . The purchases from US stockpiles are the first under the scheme .

Title: Again, FG disburses N250,000 each to small businesses
Summary: The Federal Government disbursed N250,000 in unconditional grants to outstanding small business owners in Ondo State . This is part of its ongoing nationwide intervention to empower Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises .

Title: Tinubu signs into law Nigerian Insurance Industry Reforms Bill 2025
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has assented to the Nigerian Insurance Industry Reform Bill, 2025 . It is a landmark legislation aimed at strengthening Nigeria's financial sector . The bill is aimed at accelerating the nation's march toward a $1 trillion economy .

Title: Jobe Bellingham ‘anxious’ about following Jude at Dortmund
Summary: Jobe Bellingham admitted on Tuesday to having "anxieties" on following in brother Jude's footsteps after joining Borussia Dortmund in the summer .

Title: Police debunk claims of bandits assaulting 30 Nasarawa female students
Summary: The Nasarawa State Police Command has denied claims that over 30 female students of the Federal University, Lafia were raped by bandits during a recent attack . The Command’s Public Relations Officer, Ramhan Nansel, told PUNCH Online on Tuesday that investigations revealed the report to be false . He added that the police had contacted

Title: Osun APC raises the alarm over Adeleke’s long disappearance
Summary: Osun State chapter of the All Progressives Congress raised concerns over the continued absence of Governor Ademola Adeleke, accusing him of leaving the state without notice for over two weeks . The party described the situation as “abnormal” and demanded clarification on who is currently overseeing the affairs of the state .

Title: (JUST IN) PHOTOS: 16 passengers escape death as bus sumersaults on Lagos-Ibadan Expressway
Summary: 16 passengers escaped death after a commercial bus somersaulted along the Magboro axis of the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway . The incident occurred on Tuesday evening while the bus was travelling down to Abeokuta .

Title: Adeleke travels to U.S. for Davido’s wedding
Summary: Osun State Governor, Ademola Adeleke, has travelled to the United States to attend the wedding ceremony of his nephew and music star, Davido, popularly known as Davido . Davido confirmed that he and his wife, Chioma Avril Rowland, will have their white wedding in Miami, Florida, in

Title: Katsina, UNICEF commit N1bn to tackle malnutrition crisis
Summary: The Katsina State Government and UNICEF have committed an additional N1 billion into the State’s health sector to address the prevailing malnutrition bed crisis in the state .
